title: Vast Forest Coverage
description: In 2022, Suriname boasted an impressive 94.52% of its land area covered by forests, making it one of the most forested countries in the world.

title: Limited Agricultural Land
description: As of 2022, only 0.45% of Suriname's land area was dedicated to agriculture, highlighting a potential area for development.

title: High External Debt Burden
description: In 2023, Suriname's external debt was 84.36% of its Gross National Income, indicating significant financial obligations.

title: Lengthy Electrical Connection Process
description: In 2018, it took an average of 262.3 days to obtain an electrical connection in Suriname, one of the longest durations globally.

title: High Rate of Female Children Out of School
description: As of 2023, 82.81% of female children of primary school age were out of school in Suriname, a concerning statistic for female education.

title: Gender Imbalance in Secondary Education
description: In 2015, 61.25% of students in general secondary education were female, indicating a gender imbalance in school enrollment.

title: Low Male Progression to Secondary School
description: In 2017, only 59.94% of male students progressed to secondary school, suggesting challenges in male educational advancement.

title: Low Exclusive Breastfeeding Rates
description: In 2018, only 8.92% of children under six months were exclusively breastfed in Suriname, indicating a need for improved maternal and child health practices.
